fields.description:
I am unable to attach a volume to an instance from the landing page.  I receive the error message: Unable to attach volume.  I have tested on multiple browsers and accounts.  There is nothing in the eucaconsole.log that shows any problems.  I am, however, able to attach the volume from the details page.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch an instance
2. From the volume landing page, create a volume
3. Attempt to attach the created volume from the landing page to the running instance

Expected results: You will receive an error message and the volume will not be attached.

If you attempt to attach the same volume from the details page, you should be able to.

Tested on eucaconsole version:
{code}
[root@h-07 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.4994.287.20141218git380b73b.el6   Build Date: Thu 18 Dec 2014 09:56:47 AM PST
Install Date: Thu 18 Dec 2014 10:03:36 AM PST      Build Host: ip-172-16-20-72
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.0-0.0.4994.287.20141218git380b73b.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 10113609                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
Signature   : (none)
URL         : http://github.com/eucalyptus/koala
{code}
fields.summary: Attach volume failing from landing page when only one instance is available to attach to
fields.environment: clc/cc: 10.111.5.7, nc: 10.111.5.6, also reproduced on clc: https://10.111.5.12

comments.body: [~ccassler], is this possible related, the url you reference above is not the one for the console? URL         : http://github.com/eucalyptus/koala
[~jloza]: That output is what is given using the rpm -qi command.  I think it's just outdated rpm info.  It shouldn't effect the GUI functionality.

This is still occurring with this build.
{code}
[root@h-07 keys]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.5003.290.20141222gitc340617.el6   Build Date: Mon 22 Dec 2014 09:47:53 AM PST
Install Date: Mon 22 Dec 2014 09:57:53 AM PST      Build Host: ip-172-16-20-72
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.0-0.0.5003.290.20141222gitc340617.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 10114130                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
Signature   : (none)
{code}

[~jloza], I've been able to reproduce this on 2 different clouds so I'm changing the priority to critical.   Please try to reproduce in your environment or assign the bug to whoever should be responsible to fix it.
Dupe of GUI-1517
Is this really a dupe, or just fixed with the PR from 1517?

Odd behavior regarding this...I logged in and was able to attach a current volume to an instance.  I created a new volume and was not able to attach it to any instance.  I was also no longer able to attach other volumes to instances.  I tried device(s) /dev/vdc and /dev/sdf.  I'm also not using a VPC environment.

I'd like to have this tested and vetted by engineering and QA after the fix for GUI-1517, please. Reopening this to keep track of all the comments [~ccassler] has added that might be helpful in ensuring all cases are covered, and to track testing of this bug.

I was able to attach a volume to a running instance from the volumes landing page without problems on clchost 10.111.5.145.  However, any attempt to attach a volume to a stopped instance seems to keep the volume in an "Attaching" state.

I can reproduce in these environments:

https://10.111.5.7, instance: i-08753b62, with any volume.  account: ui-test-acct-00
https://10.111.5.12, instance: i-10a87621, any volume, personal account (will most likely fail with any account).

[~ccassler]: I'm unable to reproduce this on the official QA environments -- 10.111.5.201 (VPC), 10.111.5.145 (no-VPC)

May I assign this to you to try on those environments?

[~kgill]: I am able to reproduce this issue on http://10.111.5.125:8888 using the eucalyptus/admin account.
{code}
[root@g-12-11 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.5227.20.20150227git707efe2.el6   Build Date: Fri 27 Feb 2015 10:42:05 AM PST
Install Date: Mon 09 Mar 2015 11:36:55 PM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-23
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.0-0.0.5227.20.20150227git707efe2.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 10308963                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
Signature   : (none)
{code}

[~ccassler]: I think I found a pattern to this.  The attach volume fails on the volumes landing page when only one instance is available to attach.  For some reason when there is only once instance listed in the attach list the instance ID is passed in the form as u'? string:i-0fc8a347 ?', which fails on the back end.  The issue is likely a problematic interaction between Angular and the Chosen widget for the instances list in the attach volume dialog.  Perhaps [~kyolee] has insight on a potential fix.
Changed priority to Major since there is an easy workaround.
I'm not able to reproduce this issue with one running instance. There must be some other variables, other than just having one instance running, to trigger this issue.

I just reproduced the issue on https://10.111.5.145 (10.111.5.1 backend) Steps:

1) attach volume from Volume LP
2) detach volume from Volume LP
3) attempt to attach Volume from Volume LP -> fails

I logged in as ui-test-acct-00/admin

[~alice]: I was able to reproduce using the acct-00/admin account on the 10.111.5.1 clc host when only one instance is available to attach.  After I launch another instance in AZ "two", the problem goes away as I'm able to attach volumes from the landing page.  Given that, do we still consider this ticket critical for 4.1.1?
[~kgill], I think it is a common use case when there is only one instance running in an account. I would like to have this fixed in 4.1.1

I'm still not able to reproduce this condition on my dev system setup, however I was able to reproduce this issue on 10.111.5.1 system, which have multiple availability zones setup, however, no certainty on that the multi-zone setup being the difference in the reproducibility of the issue.

The problem seems that the volume attach dialog contains 'ng-model' value assigned to the instance list select element,

<select data-placeholder="select..." id="instance_id" name="instance_id" ng-change="getDeviceSuggestion()" ng-model="instanceId" ng-options="k as v for (k, v) in instanceChoices" required="required" class="ng-dirty ng-valid ng-valid-required" style="display: none;">

However, the ng-model variable 'instanceId' is not defined in JS files, which makes the value to be 'undefined'. Since 'undefined' is not a valid option on the instance option list, Angular would try to create a new option that matches ng-model's value, which ends up looking like,

<option value="? string:i-5623f4fd ?"></option>

The reason why the value ends up being "? string:i-5623f4fd ?" might have to do with the chosen widget's setup, which also tries to set a default selected option value.

Previous solutions were to simply remove such options from the select element when detected and trigger the update on the chosen widget.

However, when I have tried to define 'instanceId' in volumes.js to monitor the value, I was having trouble trying to bind this variable from volumes.js scope. What I have also noticed is that when the dialog is opened, the dialog's templates get moved outside of the ng-app's scope, which might be the reason for the binding failure.
Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1327
Found a problem with the validation condition check.  Need to work on this some more.
PR reopened
PR has been merged to maint-4.1
